txt.en: Nestled in the foothills of the Misty Mountains, the dwarf-keep of Kidzul-kâlah lies half-sunken in the Gladdenmere. Meanwhile, a pack of worms has encroached on the old dwarf-keep….\n\nYour mission is to repel a pack of worms encroaching on Kidzul-kâlah.
You have been tasked with repelling a pack of worms encroaching on Kidzul-kâlah.
You have completed your mission.\n\nYou should talk to Ausma for your reward.
Mission: A Chill on the Gladdenmere

'I have a new mission for you, [placeholder].

'My scouts have reported a recent rise in the population of worms in the hills to the east of Kidzul-kâlah. It seems they have grown more bold as of late and have made several attempts to breach the walls of the old fortress. I do not know if they mean to nest in Kidzul-kâlah, but the Longbeards will not abide another work of dwarves stolen by dragon-kind!

'You are to travel to Kidzul-kâlah and thin the numbers of these encroaching worms. For the Gabil'akkâ!'
Complete 'Mission: A Chill on the Gladdenmere'
Some monsters in this mission will attempt a crushing attack, wounding and stunning anyone hit.
Your mission is to repel a pack of worms encroaching on Kidzul-kâlah.\n\nYou should talk to Ausma and travel to Kidzul-kâlah.

'Well done, [placeholder]!\n\n'A single worm is little trouble, but if that pack had made its way into Kidzul-kâlah, I fear it would not be long before the Goldencleft was overrun with dragon-kind. We shall have to remain vigilant!'
